question: [File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_2_list.Get()] [Slice bounds] Can an attacker call Get() with an out-of-bounds index to trigger a panic, causing validator crashes during genesis state queries and leading to network-wide DoS? (Critical)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_2_list.Set()] [Type confusion] Can an attacker provide a malicious protoreflect.Value that doesn't unwrap to *Pool, causing a type assertion panic in the Interface().(*Pool) conversion and crashing validators during genesis import? (High)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_2_list.Append()] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker craft a genesis file with millions of Pool entries to cause unbounded slice growth via repeated Append() calls, exhausting validator memory and causing consensus failure? (Critical)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_2_list.AppendMutable()] [Nil pointer] If the underlying x.list pointer is nil when AppendMutable() is called, can an attacker trigger a nil pointer dereference by appending to an uninitialized list, causing validator crashes during genesis state construction? (High)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_2_list.Truncate()] [Slice manipulation] Can an attacker provide a negative truncation index n to bypass the nil-setting loop (lines 52-56), leaving dangling Pool pointers in memory and potentially causing use-after-free vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_2_list.Len()] [Race condition] If multiple goroutines call Len() while another goroutine modifies x.list, can a race condition cause inconsistent length readings, leading to slice bounds violations in concurrent genesis state operations? (Medium)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_2_list.IsValid()] [Validation bypass] Can an attacker create a genesis state where x.list != nil but points to an empty slice, bypassing IsValid() checks while still causing issues in downstream operations that assume valid pool data? (Medium)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_2_list.NewElement()] [Resource exhaustion] Can an attacker repeatedly call NewElement() without adding elements to the list, allocating unbounded Pool objects and exhausting validator memory during genesis processing? (Medium)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_4_list.Get()] [Slice bounds] Can an attacker exploit Get() with an index >= len(*x.list) to trigger a runtime panic, causing validator crashes during PoolUids retrieval from genesis state? (Critical)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_4_list.Set()] [Type confusion] Can an attacker inject a malformed protoreflect.Value that fails the (*PoolUids) type assertion, causing validator panics during genesis state modification operations? (High)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_4_list.Append()] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker craft a genesis file with billions of PoolUids entries to cause unbounded memory allocation via Append() calls, exhausting validator resources and causing chain halts? (Critical)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_4_list.AppendMutable()] [State corruption] If AppendMutable() is called on a shared list during concurrent genesis processing, can race conditions cause duplicate or missing PoolUids entries, corrupting the DEX state? (High)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_4_list.Truncate()] [Resource leak] If Truncate() is called with n > len(*x.list), does the bounds check prevent slice corruption, or can an attacker trigger undefined behavior leading to memory corruption? (High)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: _GenesisState_4_list.Len()] [Nil dereference] If x.list is nil when Len() is called, the function returns 0, but can subsequent operations that depend on Len() == 0 to mean 'uninitialized' be confused with 'empty list', causing state validation bypasses? (Medium)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: fastReflection_GenesisState.Range()] [Nil pointer] Can an attacker trigger Range() on a GenesisState where x.Params is nil, causing the ProtoReflect() call to panic and crash validators during genesis state iteration? (High)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: fastReflection_GenesisState.Has()] [Field validation bypass] Can an attacker exploit the Has() check for pool_list (line 243) where len(x.PoolList) != 0 returns true even with an empty but non-nil slice, bypassing validation logic that expects truly unpopulated fields? (Medium)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: fastReflection_GenesisState.Clear()] [State corruption] If Clear() is called on multiple fields simultaneously during concurrent genesis operations, can race conditions leave the GenesisState in a partially cleared state, causing consensus divergence? (High)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: fastReflection_GenesisState.Get()] [Type confusion] Can an attacker request a descriptor that doesn't match any known field, causing the panic at line 310 to crash validators during genesis queries with malformed field descriptors? (Medium)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: fastReflection_GenesisState.Set()] [Type mismatch] Can an attacker call Set() for pool_list with a protoreflect.Value that doesn't contain a _GenesisState_2_list, causing the type assertion at line 330 to panic and crash validators? (High)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: fastReflection_GenesisState.Mutable()] [Nil allocation] When Mutable() allocates a new Params at line 360 if x.Params == nil, can an attacker trigger repeated allocations without persisting them, causing memory leaks during genesis processing? (Medium)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: fastReflection_GenesisState.NewField()] [Resource exhaustion] Can an attacker repeatedly call NewField() for pool_list and pool_uids_list without using the returned values, allocating unbounded slices and exhausting validator memory? (Medium)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: size()] [Integer overflow] Can an attacker craft a genesis state with a Params object whose size causes integer overflow in the calculation 'n += 1 + l + runtime.Sov(uint64(l))' at line 476, leading to undersized buffer allocation in subsequent marshaling? (Critical)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: size()] [Overflow in pool list] If len(x.PoolList) is extremely large and each Pool object has a size that causes 'l = options.Size(e)' to return a huge value, can the accumulation in lines 478-482 overflow the integer n, causing buffer overflows during marshaling? (Critical)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: size()] [Overflow in PoolsMeta] Can an attacker craft a PoolsMeta object with a size that causes 'l = options.Size(x.PoolsMeta)' at line 485 to return MaxInt, making the subsequent addition 'n += 1 + l + runtime.Sov(uint64(l))' overflow and corrupt the total size calculation? (Critical)

[File: api/zigchain/dex/genesis.pulsar.go] [Function: size()] [Overflow in PoolUids list] If len(x.PoolUidsList) contains millions of entries and each PoolUids has maximum size, can the loop at lines 488-492 cause integer overflow in n, leading to memory corruption when the undersized buffer is allocated? (Critical)
